article: Jack Baines is a self-made millionaire, but his beginnings were very lowly. He was the youngest of eight children. His father had a  _  ), but he was often  _  to work because of poor health. The family couldn't  _  to pay the rent or bills, and the children often went  _  . After leaving school at the age of 14, Jack was  _  what to do when Mr Walker, his old teacher, offered to lend him PS100 to start his own  _  . It was just after the war. Raw materials were not enough, and Jack saw a  _  in scrap metal . He bought bits of metal and stored it in an old garage. When he had built up a large amount, he sold it and  _  plenty of money. Jack  _  working hard. After one year he succeeded in  _  the PS100. By the time Jack was 30 years old he had  _  his first million, and he wanted to  _  this achievement by doing something "  _  ". With all his money it was  _  to build a beautiful home for himself and his parents. In 1959, "Baines Castle" was built in the  _  of the Lancashire countryside. It was one of the finest buildings in the country. Jack has recently sold "Baines Castle" for PS500 million,  _  Jack still can't get used to  _  the good life. He can  _  be found drinking with the locals at the local pub . "I remember being very  _  as a child, but never  _  as a child," says Jack, "and I will never forget where I came from and who I am."
